rdfs:comment: Hey, you've found the JSON-LD context for ConceptNet. This file defines everything that appears in ConceptNet API responses, mostly for the benefit of software that understands JSON-LD, but it may be reasonably human-readable too. See http://www.conceptnet.io for more information about ConceptNet, http://api.conceptnet.io/docs for the API documentation, or http://json-ld.org/ for an introduction to JSON-LD.
dc:creator: rspeer@luminoso.com

uri.comment: The URI of an edge is a slash-separated path that contains the information that fundamentally defines it -- its start, end, and relation. This serves as its @id for Linked Data purposes, so in practice, the 'uri' and '@id' fields will be equal, and you should probably be looking up the '@id' instead from now on. If you're pedantic, by 'URI' we actually mean 'IRI'. If you're not pedantic, by 'URI' we actually mean 'URL'.

rel.comment: The 'rel' property labels the kind of relationship that holds between two terms. This is the same as RDF's notion of a 'predicate'.

start.comment: The 'start' property labels the node that this edge points from. This is the same as RDF's notion of a 'subject'.

end.comment: The 'end' property labels the node that this edge points to. This is the same as RDF's notion of an 'object'.

node.comment: Features built from symmetric relations don't have to specify the 'start' or 'end'. Instead, they can just specify 'node', which matches either.

symmetric.comment: A relation, feature, or assertion can be 'symmetric', indicating that it doesn't matter which node is the 'start' or 'end'.

weight.comment: A numerical value indicating how strongly one should believe the statement this edge makes.

edges.comment: When you look up a node, its 'edges' property is a list of its incoming and outgoing edges.

features.comment: A feature selects edges that match a particular two of 'rel', 'start', and 'end' (or 'rel' and 'node', which covers both 'start' and 'end'). For example, 'parts of a car' (with rel=/r/PartOf and end=/c/en/car) is a feature.

sources.comment: The 'sources' of an edge are a set of independent reasons we believe this assertion.

dataset.comment: An identifier that separates assertions into different 'datasets' that came from different sources or processes.

surfaceText.comment: The natural language text that corresponds to an edge. This may change to an rdf:langString in the future.

license.comment: A link to the Creative Commons license under which you can remix or redistribute this information.

contributor.comment: A person or resource that contributed an assertion in ConceptNet.

process.comment: An identifier for a computational process that led to an assertion in ConceptNet.

activity.comment: An identifier for a crowd-sourcing activity that led to an assertion in ConceptNet.

seeAlso.comment: Links to this term in other Linked Data resources.
